name: Rum raisin ice cream (easy, no ice cream maker!)
description: Recipe video above. This has rum flavour unlike anything you can buy at the shops. Relish in it!EASY ice cream recipe - In this recipe, fluffy whipped cream is used to replicate the effect of incorporating air into traditional ice cream by churning in an ice cream maker. Condensed milk, meanwhile, keeps the mixture from freezing into a solid block and keeps it creamy and scoop-able, just like real ice cream! Skeptical? Don't blame you. Read glowing reviews here and here!
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup rum, dark or golden ( (preferably Jamaican! Note 2))
2 cups thickened/heavy cream, fridge cold ((any whipping cream works))
Rum raisin chocolate (, finely chopped (pictured in post))

itemListElement.text: Chop - Roughly chop the raisins (about in half) and break them up with your fingers so they are not stuck together.
itemListElement.name: Chop - Roughly chop the raisins (about in half) and break them up with your fingers so they are not stuck together.

itemListElement.text: Soak - Heat the rum in a small saucepan on medium high, just until hot. Add raisins, spread to submerge as best you can. Then leave to soak for 30 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Soak - Heat the rum in a small saucepan on medium high, just until hot. Add raisins, spread to submerge as best you can. Then leave to soak for 30 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Pour off excess - The raisins should absorb most of the rum. If not, see Note 4.
itemListElement.name: Pour off excess - The raisins should absorb most of the rum. If not, see Note 4.

itemListElement.text: Condensed milk & flavourings - Place the condensed milk, rum, vanilla and all-spice in a bowl. Briefly beat just to combine with a handheld beater (or mix by hand), then stir in the rum soaked raisins.
itemListElement.name: Condensed milk & flavourings - Place the condensed milk, rum, vanilla and all-spice in a bowl. Briefly beat just to combine with a handheld beater (or mix by hand), then stir in the rum soaked raisins.

itemListElement.text: Whipped cream - Place the cream in a separate large bowl and beat on high with an electric beater for 2 1/2 to 3 minutes until well whipped (stand mixer 1 - 1 1/2 minutes). We're not looking for "soft whipped" here, we want stiff peaks and good aeration!
itemListElement.name: Whipped cream - Place the cream in a separate large bowl and beat on high with an electric beater for 2 1/2 to 3 minutes until well whipped (stand mixer 1 - 1 1/2 minutes). We're not looking for "soft whipped" here, we want stiff peaks and good aeration!

itemListElement.text: Fold together - Fold about 1 cup whipped cream into the condensed milk mixture. Once mostly incorporated (some lumps is fine), pour the condensed milk mixture into the cream and gently continue folding until smooth (minimise folding as less aeration = denser ice cream). To help remove lumps, "smear" visible cream bits across the surface or against the side of the bowl rather than vigorously stirring.
itemListElement.name: Fold together - Fold about 1 cup whipped cream into the condensed milk mixture. Once mostly incorporated (some lumps is fine), pour the condensed milk mixture into the cream and gently continue folding until smooth (minimise folding as less aeration = denser ice cream). To help remove lumps, "smear" visible cream bits across the surface or against the side of the bowl rather than vigorously stirring.

itemListElement.text: Freeze 12 hours - Spread in a 1.5 litre / 1.5 quart container (Note 6). Cover with lid or cling wrap. Freeze at least 12 hours.
itemListElement.name: Freeze 12 hours - Spread in a 1.5 litre / 1.5 quart container (Note 6). Cover with lid or cling wrap. Freeze at least 12 hours.

itemListElement.text: Serve! To scoop, you'll only need to leave it out for a minute or two, like real ice cream! Then scoop and serve in bowls or in cones. I topped mine with chopped rum raisin chocolate, because, why not? :)
itemListElement.name: Serve! To scoop, you'll only need to leave it out for a minute or two, like real ice cream! Then scoop and serve in bowls or in cones. I topped mine with chopped rum raisin chocolate, because, why not? :)

review.reviewBody: Oh my gosh! This recipe is AMAZING! I canâ€™t find rum n raisin in any of the stores (Essex, UK), so decided to make my own using this recipe. WOW! Top tip - it will set quicker if you use small single pots so I made a couple to eat before the big tub sets in the morning! ðŸ¤£ Thank you so much for this!
Now I'm thinking - Peach & Bourbon, Prune & Whisky, Golden Sultana & Muscat, Cranberry & Cointreau.....so many creamy boozy fruity adventures!

I recently tried this rum and raisin ice cream recipe, and I must say, it was a delightful experience. The balance of flavors was absolutely spot on. Each spoonful was a harmonious blend of rich, velvety ice cream infused with the perfect amount of rum, complementing the sweetness of the raisins exquisitely. The raisins were plump and juicy, providing a lovely texture contrast to the creamy base. What truly stood out was how the rum flavor was present yet not overpowering, allowing the natural creaminess of the ice cream to shine through. This recipe is a masterful take on a classic flavor, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a luxurious and satisfying treat. A true culinary triumph!
Okay and after eating this, our go to for years - Hagen Daz rum and raisin tastes meh. This is amazing, boozy ice cream.
Dear Nagi, thank you so much for this wonderful recipe. I put  coffee powder in and it is soooo irresistible. Will make it again and again...
Absolutely love this recipe ðŸ˜‹ I think I will leave the raisins to soak for longer next time I make it. I'm going to experiment with different flavours ðŸ˜Š

I made this ice cream for the first time today. However, I took the non-alcoholic route, using Rum Extract. When I was reading the recipe, I was like, "There's no mention of sugar. How is it going to be sweet enough without adding sugar?" Well, boy did I learn how sweet condensed sweetened milk is. It is perfectly sweet; the rum and raisins' pas de deux across my palate, amidst the cloud-like lightness of the cream and vanilla bean, was exceptionally delectable. Thank you for posting this recipe.

Hi, has anyone tried to throw all the ingredients into an actual ice cream churn machine to see if it works? I'm curious as I have access to a churn.  The recipe is delicious, I don't want to waste ingredients so thought I would ask?? .............. But if its a flop I suppose I could still eat it :)

I love the strong rum flavour in this ice cream! I didnâ€™t listen to Nagi to chop the raisins in half, i left them whole. Big mistake! They swelled up so much when steeped in the rum that they sunk to the bottom of the ice cream. Lesson learned, follow the recipe & listen to Nagi.

I gave 4 stars because it was way too sweet. I made it a second time, cut the raisins this time & added 600ml of cream, instead of 500ml (2 cups). Also added 1/4 tsp fine salt to the condensed milk, to balance sweetness & bring out more flavour. What an improvement!
Great Recipe! I do not have enough rum, could I use whiskey to soak raisin instead?

Great recipe!  Flavor and texture were great.  Recipe was easy, and well written, but raisins were VERY difficult to chop.  I tried both a hand chopper and scissors without success.  Also, a 1.5 liter or qt. dish is NOT big enough.  Mine overflowed.  Suggest at least a 2 qt or liter dish. Please note that 3/4 cup rum equals 6 ounces.  For 6 servings, that is the equivalent of a drinking a full standard  alcoholic drink, i.e. 1 oz. alcohol per serving.  Love it, but be careful!  Thanks for the recipe.

Amazing! Iâ€™ve always wanted to make homemade ice cream but it always looked too complicated. This was so easy (as all of your other recipes so far) and delicious. I had half and half instead of whipping cream so I was worried it wouldnâ€™t turn out right since it was not as firm as it looked like in the pics and video but it turned out great! Iâ€™ve already shared the recipe with lots of friends.

keywords: easy ice cream, no churn ice cream, rum raisin ice cream, Strawberry Ice Cream
